intro: Onobroma armenium, commonly known as the Armenian torchwood, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, orange-red flowers that bloom in late summer and early fall. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often have a hairy texture. Onobroma armenium is typically found in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments.
